segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose there was a man with a lifespan of a hundred years.
And someone might say to him:

segments.pli: ‘ehambho purisa, pubbaṇhasamayaṃ taṃ sattisatena hanissanti, majjhanhikasamayaṃ sattisatena hanissanti, sāyanhasamayaṃ sattisatena hanissanti.
segments.en: ‘Come now, my good man, they’ll strike you with a hundred spears in the morning, at midday, and in the late afternoon.

segments.pli: So kho tvaṃ, ambho purisa, divase divase tīhi tīhi sattisatehi haññamāno vassasatāyuko vassasatajīvī vassasatassa accayena anabhisametāni cattāri ariyasaccāni abhisamessasī’ti.
segments.en: And you’ll live for a hundred years being struck with three hundred spears every day. But when a hundred years have passed, you will comprehend the four noble truths for the first time.’
For an earnest and gentleman this is sufficient reason to submit.

segments.pli: pubbā koṭi nappaññāyati sattippahārānaṃ asippahārānaṃ usuppahārānaṃ pharasuppahārānaṃ.
segments.en: No first point is found of blows by spears, swords, arrows, and axes.

segments.pli: Na kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, saha dukkhena, saha domanassena catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ abhisamayaṃ vadāmi;
segments.en: But the comprehension of the four noble truths doesn’t come with pain or sadness, I say.

segments.pli: api cāhaṃ, bhikkhave, sahāva sukhena, sahāva somanassena catunnaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ abhisamayaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: Rather, the comprehension of the four noble truths comes only with pleasure and happiness, I say.

segments.pli: Dukkhassa ariyasaccassa … pe … dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya ariyasaccassa.
segments.en: The noble truths of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

sections.title: “Mendicants, suppose there was a man with a lifespan…

suttaplex.blurb: Even more than if you’re being tortured with spikes, you should make an effort to understand the four noble truths.
